document_data.mainbody:
Mulad was a shair and the middle son of Alia bint Hazir and Sultan Yusef al-Wadi of Gana in the Pearl Cities region of west Zakhara.
Mulad was quite rebellious. He strove to prove to his older brother, Yusef, that the powers of magic far outweighed those of the sword.
He had a mole under his right eye in the shape of a butterfly.
As with all of his siblings, Mulads parentage was kept secret from the population of Gana. He was raised in a monastery high in Al-Yabki Mountains.
